Name: Fragment of a statue
Description: This fragment of a statue of greeny coloured schist depicts a standing god with a falcon's head. The beak, the eyes, the lower part below the pelvis and the legs are missing. A was-sceptre is depicted on the torso. The back pillar reaches as high as the lower edge of the wig. The piece was originally in the É. de Meester de Ravestein collection and dates to the Late Period.
